Reviews.Content: totally adequate. I had read some pretty bad reviews about this hotel, but as we were staying only one night and it was cheap (鈧?5.00 for a four bed room) and near the station, I said let's do it. It was great. The reception staff were nice and helpful and spoke english and french. The breakfast was great and there was loads of it. The garden was lovely. The rooms were air conditioned although we couldn't turn it up but at least it wasn't hot enough to have to open the windows. Which was lucky as we had a room on the main road. My husband thought it a bit noisy but the kids and I slept like logs. It was close to everything and had a locked room where you could keep your bags when you checked out, if you wanted to have a wander around before leaving Florence.Ok the decor in the rooms was a wee bit 70's but the rooms were clean and tidy. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to go back and would recommend it to anyone.
Reviews.Author: Bull9

Reviews.Content: In Need of Rehab Stayed at the Castri in April of 2008. The staff was pleasant enough, but the rooms looked like a cheap motel. This hotel is in bad need of a rehab. The furniture, the fixtures, and the carpets, all worn, cheap and sometimes broken. Don't spend too much on this place. For tightwads only. The breakfast was decent, though. Rolls, cornetti, jellies, ham slices, cheese slices, coffee, milk, cereals, juices, and fruits. The location was pretty decent. Fairly close to the train station, but a good walk from the Ponte Vecchio.
Reviews.Author: JJFB

Reviews.Content: Warning! Don't stay here! This hotel was disgusting! It was dirty, smelly  run down. The carpet was dirty  stained. The timber shutters were rotting, the walls were shabby. The bathroom was small with a revolting shower curtain  the floor easily flooded. The linen towels (more like over sized tea towels) were useless. A foul smell resembling cheap hair cream pervaded everything  made us feel ill. We could barely endure our two nights there. The breakfast room resembled a cheap, bare cafeteria. Food that should have been refrigerated was left out  was dry  unpalatable. Jam portions etc remained in the cartons in which they were delivered. Water for tea  coffee was warm. This was by far the worst hotel we stayed in during our three months abroad  it is 'hands down' the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. A one star rating would be an exaggeration.
Reviews.Author: JanSydney

Reviews.Content: Great holiday - but be aware of the difference in room standards There appears to be two types of rooms in this hotel 鈥?one type which I can only rate as disgusting and the other type which is lovely. We arrived with an open mind after reading these reviews, having booked a double room with 鈥渃ity/garden views鈥? We were first checked into a room with 2 single beds and a view of a wall. Further, the bathroom and carpet were disgusting and the room stank of stale smoke. After showing the guy on the desk our booking confirmation, which stated 鈥榗ity/garden views鈥? we were promptly allocated another room. We couldn鈥檛 believe the difference between the 2 rooms and were very happy with the switch. The new room had wooden floors, a clean bathroom with a shower, was bright and airy and boasted fantastic views of the garden and city. The hotel is in a perfect location, close to the market and the Duomo. So the motto of the story is if you stay here and are checked into a room below the standard you were expecting, don鈥檛 settle.
Reviews.Author: TravEJ

Reviews.Content: Basic, cheap and great location Just returned from having stayed at the Hotel Castri for 4 nights. The hotel is very centrally situated. 5/10 minute walk from the main station and the Duomo and a stone's throw from the local market. Was a bit perturbed after I had booked the rooms and then read some of these reviews. To be honest for what we paid, the rooms were fine. They were clean and quiet (I faced onto the garden at the back of the hotel). The staff were friendly and the breakfast filled a gap! Bread rolls, croissants, jams, yogurt, hams and cheese. I would ignore the 3* rating as it is more 2*. The rooms are fairly basic with very small shower room. This was my first time in Florence so can't really compare it to any other hotels in the area. If I go back, I'll book the Castri again. Cheap, basic and great location.
Reviews.Author: Glasgow15

Reviews.Content: The Worst Hotel in Italy The person that says Avoid it like the plauge is absolutely right. The hotel was filthy, and the staff was about as far from helpful as you can imagine. We checked in, went to our room and decided sleeping in the car was a better option- the bathroom was filthy, the room was covered in dirt. We told the front desk we didn't want to stay, and they made us pay regardless because we had just checked in.We figured it was worth it to pay to avoid catching a deadly virus.
Reviews.Author: Slamma

Reviews.Content: Avoid like the plague We arrived at Castri to find an average looking entrance with a single car space outside. This would turn out to be the highlight of our stay. This is a hotel that seems to take absolutely no pride whatsoever in any aspect of its tenure. It is stripped to the bone, catering to the lowest possible level of acceptability. The graffiti in the lifts was disgusting, the shower was horrid, the room's bare walls covered in mould. Unless you are booking for your worst enemy, spend the extra few Euro on somewhere half decent. Please.
Reviews.Author: samb1

Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here!! Okay, so a lot of websites are rating this (and in fact the Italian... hotel board? Whoever makes those signs with the stars) is calling this a 3 star hotel. It is NOT. The staff was rude and unfriendly, the room had no heat and they told me basically too bad when I said the radiator wasn't working. They started doing repairs to the drywall outside the door of our room at about 7:45 a.m. Overall, it was the WORST hotel experience out of many in Italy. The only good thing about this hotel is that it is next to Pizzeria Giardina di Barbano, which is a great cheap pizza place. But honestly... don't stay here. Gross.
Reviews.Author: puchina

Reviews.Content: Bad experience We booked for the price and location. Location is good, 10 minute walk from the core....but that was about the only good thing. We may have just happened upon a really bad room, but it was disgusting! The bathroom reeked and the tub was small and dingy. The carpet was so filthy we couldn't take our shoes off and the lock didn't seem to work on the door. We asked for a switch but there was three of us so i think the options were limited. We left the window open a bit at night to air the place out and were attacked by big juicy mosquitos which we spent most of the night squashing against the walls.All I can say is thank gawd we only booked for one night. Never again!
Reviews.Author: Milan,IT

Reviews.Content: Excellent value hotel, great location Very close ( 5 to 10 minute walk) to the train station and within walking distance of all attractions (e.g. 10 minutes to Duomo). Neighbourhood seems pretty nice - maybe a bit too quiet at night for a traveler, but didn't feel dangerous (we walked back very late one night around midnight after getting lost a bit north of here. A bit of traffic, not many people walking around though). Close to many internet cafes as well as the Mercanto market. Nice unique rooms (fancy wooden shutters to look out on the street, high ceiling, etc.) and friendly staff. Nice quick breakfast included. Free postcards, nice tough. Like many Italian hotels, you must leave your room key with the front desk when you leave - a bit disturbing that they don't check ID when you return to collect your key. Good value for money. I think that we would stay here again if we visited Florence.
Reviews.Author: thejdmba
